articles.author: Doina Chiacu, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that his proposed 25% tariffs on Mexican and Canadian goods will go into effect on March 4 and threatened an extra 10% duty on Chinese imports because deadly drugs are still pouring into the U.S. from those countries.
articles.title: Trump vows March 4 tariffs for Mexico, Canada, extra 10% for China over fentanyl

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump and sign a critical minerals deal on Friday as Kyiv works to regain U.S. support to fight off the Russian invasion as Washington reverses its punitive policy towards Moscow.
articles.title: Trump, Zelenskiy to sign minerals deal at White House meeting

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.description: Pilots first heard about a Chinese live-fire naval exercise near Australia last week when already in the air, receiving messages that forced some to change paths through a busy air corridor, satellite text messages to and from pilots seen by Reuters show.
articles.title: Exclusive: Airline pilots surprised by Chinese live-fire warning near Australia, messages show

articles.author: Joe Cash, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Beijing said on Friday it opposed President Donald Trump's latest threat to slap an extra 10% duty on Chinese imports, accusing the U.S. of "shifting the blame" on the flow of fentanyl and promising retaliation to protect its interests.
articles.title: China says it opposes latest US tariff threat after Trump sets Tuesday deadline

articles.author: Poppy Mcpherson, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Four Chinese nationals accused by the Philippines of espionage led Chinese Communist Party-affiliated groups that made donations of cash to a Philippine city and vehicles to two police forces, according to photos, videos and online posts seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Alleged Chinese spies gave Philippine city and police cash and motorbikes

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday there were "pretty good talks going on" regarding Gaza, when asked about the future of the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas militants, but he offered little detail at a White House press conference.
articles.title: Trump says ongoing Gaza talks are 'pretty good'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States embassy in Bangkok on Friday issued a security alert for its citizens in Thailand, a day after the secretive deportation of 40 Uyghurs to China that has drawn international condemnation.
articles.title: US embassy issues security alert in Thailand after Uyghurs' deportation to China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis, who has been hospitalised for two weeks battling double pneumonia, has spent another peaceful night and is now resting, the Vatican said on Friday.
articles.title: Pope is resting after another peaceful night, Vatican says

articles.author: Daria Sito-Sucic
articles.description: Bosnia's autonomous Serb region passed legislation barring the state police and judiciary from its territory after a court sentenced its separatist leader Milorad Dodik to a year in jail and banned him from politics for six years.
articles.title: Serb region bars Bosnian state authorities in separatist move

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Kenan Gashi saws the limbs off old mannequins in his shop in Kosovo and throws them into machines donated by the U.S. government that shred and clean the plastic so it can be sold for reuse.
articles.title: Kosovo businesses under threat from Trump's USAID freeze
